summary: "I Have a Dream" is a famous speech given by Martin Luther King Jr. in 1963 during a civil rights march in Washington, D.C. He talked about his dream for equality and freedom for all, especially African Americans. King wanted an end to racism and for everyone to be treated fairly. Over 250,000 people heard him speak, and it's considered one of the most important speeches in American history. King's words were so powerful that they are still remembered and celebrated today.
title: I Have a Dream
